page.title: 14Landscape.
page.content: 'This is what we saw when we explored the Stalybridge side of Hough Hill, which is where our school is in Dukinfield. There were some semi-detached houses, and some three and two storey blocks of flats. There is a pub called 'The British Protection'. It had a pub sign of a soldier in a red coat with a rifle. Just 2 streets away, there is a pub with the name 'The Thirteenth Mounted Cheshire Riflemen Inn.'There are two Churches. St. Peters Roman Catholic Church stands next to its own school and nursery. On the by-pass, stands a new church, The Methodist Church, Stalybridge. The church us round in design, and has a spire in the middle. Some children from our school have been baptised here. Behind these streets,is the grass of HoughHill.'
